statement: The authors expand the well-established divisive normalization model to capture the responses to bi-speed stimuli.
The normalization model formulation is mostly a restatement of the results - that the faster and slower speeds differentially affect the combined response - rather than providing new insights.

The modified divisive normalization model with mean population response interposed does not clearly demonstrate how much the actual tuning curve matters, since the main effect is to flatten it out by averaging the functions.
The study would benefit from examining how robust the statistical results are to different assumptions about the normalization pool.
